title: Marketing Operations Specialist
content:
Job Summary
This position will provide support for various Retail Marketing programs with the primary responsibilities of planning and managing the use, distribution process and inventory of marketing materials through relationships with design, printing and fulfillment partners as well as Sales and Compliance. This role will also support the Senior Marketing Specialist in day to day responsibilities.
The Marketing Operations Specialist position will be part of the Retail Operations organization reporting to the Director of Marketing Operations. 
Duties and Responsibilities

Provide quality sales materials and forms to appropriate sources with focus on speed to market i.e. Archway; Quik Forms; Ondeck; Adobe DAM; Toppan Merrill
Ensure accessibility of sales materials and forms on multiple platforms are easily obtainable
Ensure repository of marketing material across multiple platforms is synchronized, managed efficiently and is easily reported upon
Create and provide process documents for all procedures relating to collateral management and platforms used to complete these tasks
Evaluate, make recommendation and implement automated process and procedures to reduce or supplant manual workloads
Provide accurate, timely reporting on all materials (print and digital) to meet both department and inter-departmental needs
Assist with literature orders from the sales team by being liaison between F&G Sales and our fulfillment vendor, as needed
Assist in maintaining positive company image
Print Implementation/Execution:

Assist in managing the print fulfillment process to provide timely, accurate, and cost-effective distribution of marketing materials by fulfillment partner, while maintiaing quality control standards.
Assist with providing print specs and files to fulfillment vendor when notified by design team that these are ready to be sent over


Administration of digital materials:

Ensure that the information represented from a Marketing Material and forms perspective on Saleslink, Public site, Efficient Technology, Adobe DAM, Toppan Merrill and other associated digital forums are correct and up to date.
Provide accurate, timely reporting on all materials to meet both department and inter-departmental needs.
Works closely with various stakeholders to ensure that marketing material and forms are displayed accurately on Storefront, the vendor websites and inventory is up to date and maintained at optimum levels. 
Works with various departments to get marketing materials and forms updated in a sandbox environment including filtering, product orientation, etc.
Perform quality assurance by spot checking work prior to production.


Version Creation & Control:

Accurately edit forms when required and ensure forms are uploaded and made available for print within requested time frame on various platforms such as Quik Forms, Ondeck, Storefront, Toppan Merrill, Adobe DAM, Archway, SIMON, etc.
Assist with the management of third party vendor to make forms fillable by coordinating in conjunction with active projects to ensure materials are available within identified schedule.



Experience and Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required
1-3 years of experience in marketing communications, marketing or financial services company.
Insurance or financial institutions industry experience is strongly preferred

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must work in a collaborative environment and take direction from a number of individuals at the same time based on project demand
Must be detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
Strong administrative skills
Strong skills in Microsoft Office, Adobe and Acrobat
Ability to quickly adapt to change
Demonstrated management and leadership aptitude, including prerequisite communication skills (verbal, written and presentation)
Aptitude to work in a fast-paced production environment while addressing multiple projects and responsibilities at one time

#LI-RemoteAdditional Information 
Work Environments
F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.
Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers
About F&G
Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.
As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.
1Top Workplaces USA 2022 – 2023 
2Des Moines Register Top Workplaces 2018 – 2022
